questions.question: He was older .................... I thought.
questions.description: 'Than' is the word used in comparative structures. 'Then' is an adverb indicating time.

questions.question: China is ............................ India.
questions.description: Adjectives of one or two syllables form their comparative forms by adding -er to the positive.

questions.question: Susie is .................................... of the four girls.
questions.description: We use the comparative to compare one person or thing with another person or thing. We use the superlative to compare somebody or something with the whole group they/it belong(s) to.

questions.question: I am not as ................................... my brother.
questions.description: We use the structure as...as... to make comparisons using positive adjectives.

questions.question: That was the ................................ thing to do.
questions.description: The article 'the' indicates that a superlative adjective is following.

questions.question: It was ...................................... gift I have ever received.
questions.description: The comparative is used in expressions with than.

questions.question: For .................................. information, please visit our website.
questions.description: Farther indicates distance. Further means additional.

questions.question: She owns a ............................. collection of antiques.
questions.description: The article 'a' indicates that we need a positive adjective here.

questions.question: It was ............................... than I was expecting.
questions.description: The conjunction 'than' indicates that we need a comparative adjective here.

questions.question: They are both good girls, but I think Mary is the .................. of the two.
questions.description: We do not normally use the superlative when the group includes only two persons or things.

questions.question: This is the ................................ kitchen I have ever seen.
The older I get, .......................................
questions.description: The word order in both clauses should be: the + comparative expression + subject + verb.
